title: Augusta County: John Scott to Samuel Hunt, January 25, 1866
summary: John Scott provides a summary of many of his day-to-day chores and mentions a recent hunting trip, saying that the excursion was his first day of leisure in Staunton. The letter also serves to highlight his dissatisfaction with C. E. Dewey, an AMA teacher under his supervision.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Arts/Leisure, Race Relations, Women, American Civil War
